Title: Open subgroups of a topological group are closed
Content: Let $G$ be a topological group such that for each $x \in G$ the mapping $x\mapsto xy$ is a  homeomorphism. If $H$ is a open subgroup of $G$, prove that $H$ is also closed Could anyone just give hint for this one?
AcceptedAnswer: We just need to show that the complement $G \setminus H$ is open, so take $y \in G \setminus H$. Note that $Hy = \{ xy : x \in H \}$ is an open neighbourhood of $y$ (since $1 \in H$, and the mapping $x \mapsto xy$ sends open sets to open sets).  This set is also disjoint from $H$, since given $x \in H$, if $xy \in H$ then $y = x^{-1}(xy) \in H$, which is false by assumption).
